p: Essential oils constitute mixtures of volatile compounds, sesquiterpenes, and primarily monoterpenes [ 19]. The main components of the essential oils isolated from L. angustifolia tissue are, among others, linalool, borneol, geraniol, and linalool acetate [ 20, 21]. The composition of an essential oil depends mainly on the plant genotype, yet its composition may differ under the influence of developmental and environmental factors, i.e., sun exposure, plant age, seedling collection method or essential oil isolation method [ 22, 23].
